availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Stovall (Ballard County, Kentucky, justice of the peace)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Hannah Stovall. Father of Alfred Stovall, James Stovall, Hardy Stovall, Catherine Stovall, Rhoda Stovall, William H. H. Stovall, Caroline C. Stovall, and Martha Stovall. Postmaster of Blandville in 1842. Farmer in Blandville in 1850. Justice of the peace in Blandville in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 276. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 19. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 9. Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, volume 12a, p. 244, (accessed via Ancestry.com). Find A Grave, "John Hardin Stovall (1806-1884)," Memorial #26199702, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=26199702&ref=acom (accessed June 22, 2017).
